title: [Large-scale] Virtual Reality-Based Learning Course for Trauma-Informed Environment Construction

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary theories and practical experience in social work or human services
context.additional_context: Practical training utilizing virtual reality simulations to enable current practitioners to apply trauma-informed environments in real-world settings

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain at least three trauma-inducing elements in VR environments.
Learners can propose at least two improvements to physical environment design based on trauma-informed principles.
Learners can revise and refine improvement strategies at least once based on peer feedback after VR simulations.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
